tweet: Thank you for your kind words, General Rice. I will continue to support our men and women in military and promote the values that have made our great nation strong. https://www.wtok.com/content/news/ANG-director-visits-Key-Field-NCO-honored-505101422.html …

Mississippians deserve to have access to healthcare services in their communities. It was a pleasure to visit the Covington County Hospital in Collins today and meet with CEO Gregg Gibbes to discuss policy issues affecting rural hospitals. pic.twitter.com/SeD08xMNui

Abortion at anytime is immoral, but a bill allowing abortions when a woman is showing physical signs of labor is unconscionable. We must continue to be a voice for our unborn children and oppose any such bill introduced in Congress. https://bit.ly/2WqihJc

I’m honored to join so many talented Freshmen Members on @HouseHomeland, including @RepMarkGreen, @RepDanCrenshaw, @RepVanTaylor, and @RepJohnJoyce. I look forward to working with them and our colleagues on both sides of the aisle to keep our country safe. https://youtu.be/v_06cDD7Wng?t=4015 …

As a former prosecutor of numerous drug interdiction cases, I know that securing our southwest border is necessary. I hope that an agreement can be reached on a solution to the crisis at the border so that our government can remain open past February 15.

The MS School for the Blind is shaping new ways of teaching and learning. It was a pleasure to discuss how our office can be a resource as they create more opportunities for the blind and visually impaired pic.twitter.com/owICEoVKJ7

I was honored to welcome the Georgian Parliamentary Delegation & the First Vice Speaker of the Parliament into our office today. Democracy across our globe is vital to the prosperity of all nations & I was honored to discuss how our two nations can continue to work together. pic.twitter.com/VkUAP2vFfb

This is great news for the people of Mississippi. Our energy industry is growing under conservative leadership and this expansion will lead to an even stronger economy for all Mississippians. https://www.wapt.com/article/entergy-nuclear-adding-more-than-300-jobs-in-mississippi/26028749 …

The Department of Homeland Security released new data showing the number of apprehensions between the points of entry on our southwest border has increased 81 percent this FY. Additional border security and a physical barrier is needed to end this trend, and it’s needed now.

It was a pleasure to sit down with Mayor Percy Bland to discuss how we can work together to benefit Meridian and all of East Mississippi. I will continue to work with our local leaders for the people of Mississippi and the Third District. pic.twitter.com/PR6xwCgS9U

I strongly disagree with @SpeakerPelosi’s decision to deny @POTUS the chance to address our nation. As a country we need to work to end divisiveness and look for compromise, and I can’t think of a more appropriate event to bring us together for than a State of the Union address.

I’m honored to announce that I have been selected to serve on @HouseHomeland & @HouseForeignGOP. In these two roles I will work to ensure that our nation is secure & that Mississippi remains a safe place to live, worship, and raise a family. https://bit.ly/2FIAHzT
Please visit our website,  http://guest.house.gov  or call (202) 225-5031 to let us know about your visit!

We were honored to have Madison County Judge Staci O’Neal and Meghan Pritchard, a UMMC physical therapy student, swing by the office today while they are in town for an American Physical Therapy Association Conference. pic.twitter.com/1sxidPQQcr

The number of people who attended the March for Life event last weekend was incredible. Hundreds of thousands of people participated to spread awareness on Pro-Life issues, and their voices were heard! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=80fS4MClWC4 …

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. changed our nation with his tenacity, his love for his fellow man, and a firm faith in our Heavenly Father. Today is a day to remember and honor the sacrifice he made and the example he set for all people. pic.twitter.com/djwRuZdBf4

This week, I signed a letter asking @POTUS to veto any legislation that would use taxpayer dollars to perform abortions. Thank you, @RealDonaldTrump, for your response and for standing up for the unborn in your letter to @SpeakerPelosi. 

 https://chrissmith.house.gov/uploadedfiles/final_190118_-_letter_to_speaker.pdf …

We are now approaching 50 years since the ruling of Roe v. Wade, but the momentum to protect the right to life of our unborn children is growing every day. As your Congressman, I will continue to be a voice for our unborn children. pic.twitter.com/kVH35NU0rj

The scientific community is beginning to reveal what we’ve always known through our faith. https://www.realclearpolitics.com/articles/2019/01/16/why_science_strengthens_the_pro-life_argument_139181.html …

I’ve announced my support of pro-life legislation by joining the Congressional Pro-Life Caucus & by cosponsoring legislation to declare life begins at conception. The lives of our unborn children are special & I will continue to be a voice for the unborn. https://bit.ly/2FDuiVQ

I’ve enjoyed the insight I’ve gained from my new colleagues and friends in the freshman class. @RepGregPence dropped by today to discuss the important issues facing our districts and the many issues we’ll work to address as freshmen members. pic.twitter.com/34VnZrHIcD

As District Attorney, I prosecuted those who transported and sold illegal drugs in our communities. Now, as your Congressman, I will fight to secure our border so that we can prevent the flow of drugs into our cities and towns.

We had two visitors drop by the office today – May Lin and Yao Hsiao from the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office (TECRO). @GreggHarper visited Taiwan on a trip last year & we hope to maintain a strong relationship between our offices with our international partner pic.twitter.com/818lbzGWPZ

Faith & prayer have been the cornerstone of my life as a Christian husband, father, & prosecutor. The decision to join the Congressional Prayer Caucus stems from my own personal belief in the power that prayer can have to shape the future of our nation: https://bit.ly/2TDoAXy

Today, I encourage you to take some time to thank a law enforcement officer or first responder for their service to our communities. Across our state, men and women risk their lives to keep us safe – today, we thank them. #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay pic.twitter.com/wfJAzqWYES

I joined @HaleyBarbour & @SenatorWicker this morning to speak to a group of Ole Miss students visiting DC through the Barbour Endowment to learn about our government. Our future is in good hands if we continue to offer programs to develop our students into the leaders of tomorrow pic.twitter.com/KZcuvXRsi6
Thank you, Senator. I look forward to working closely with you for the people of the great state of Mississippi!

I’m honored to serve the great people of Mississippi as the newest Representative of the Third District. Thank you, @GreggHarper, for your service and I look forward to what the Lord has in store for you. https://twitter.com/WTOKTV/status/1080888197989785600 …
